page.title: 06STILE FARM
page.content: {Stile Farm}is a very big one owned by {Lord Courtenay.}It has roughly 3700 acres of land. 1200 acres of land are crops. Barley, potatoes, corn, wheat, swede and peas are grown. Of course, machinery is also on the farm. There are 8 tractors, combine and potato harvesters, rollers, balers and fertiliser spreaders. A lot of the land is used for animals. They have mostly South Devon cows and sheep. Some of the cows are used for beef and the sheep are sheared in the middle of May. They have 5 workers, 2 of which are only part time. Farmers have trouble with rabbits and mice. Rats come from the river and crows eat the crops. In the winter animals and crops are put in barns. Cattle eat silage, barley and hay. Sheep eat hay, silage and root crops.The Common Market has caused a great increase in paperwork.
